Title: Ford: Monthly Sales Drop, Company Looks To New Vehicles
Description: Cruising along the ever-stretching road of decline. Auto giant Ford Motor (nyse: F - news - people ) reported vehicle sales in October that fell 5 from a year ago.

Title: United #39;s pension dilemma
Description: United Airlines says it likely will end funding for employee pension plans, a move that would be the largest ever default by a US company and could lead to a taxpayer-funded bailout rivaling the savings-and-loan fiasco of the 1980s.

Title: China Closes 1,600 Internet Cafes in Crackdown
Description: China shut 1,600 Internet cafes between February and August and imposed \$12.1 million worth of fines for allowing children to play violent or adult-only games and other violations, state media said.

Title: Obesity Solution: Nuke It
Description: Eying that juicy steak but worried about your waistline? Sharp says it has developed a new fat-busting microwave oven that can melt some of your worries away.

Title: Agassi Overcomes Verdasco Power
Description: STOCKHOLM (Reuters) - Andre Agassi marched into the  Stockholm Open semifinals Friday, beating Spanish eighth seed  Fernando Verdasco 7-6, 6-2 in his toughest match of the  tournament.

Title: Cycling: Ulmer #39;s scorching times in secret rides
Description: New Zealand #39;s star cyclist, Sarah Ulmer, last week rode under world record time twice in an hour during a secret training session in France.

Title: Large Explosion Heard in Central Baghdad (Reuters)
Description: Reuters - A large blast was heard in central\Baghdad on Thursday, witnesses said.

Title: Israel OKs More West Bank Settlement Homes
Description: JERUSALEM Aug. 23, 2004 - Israel announced plans Monday to build hundreds of new housing units in the West Bank, following an apparent US policy shift on settlements that the Palestinians warned  quot;will destroy the peace process.
